Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameBoard Class stores the requisite data, moves, and updates Piece[][] pieceLocation data field where the information is stored for any given game.

      GameBoard()

    • Method Detail

      • getSquare

        public Piece getSquare(int row,
                       int column)
        Parameters:
        row - a positive int, must be between 0 and 4 or it will cause a nullPointerException error
        column - a positive int, must be between 0 and 4 or it will cause a nullPointerException error
        Returns:
        a Piece object representing a specific location on the game board.

      • getFlag

        public boolean getFlag(java.lang.String color)
        Parameters:
        color - must be either "Blue", "Green", "Yellow", or "Red". Any other String will always return false.
        Returns:
        a boolean whether or not it has found a flag Piece or a pawn Piece with the associated flag color. It stops when a flag of the chosen color has been found.

      • capturePiece

        public boolean capturePiece(int die1,
                            int die2)
        Parameters:
        die1 - any int value.
        die2 - any int value.
        Returns:
        if one of the two int values int die1 and int die2 have a difference of 2 or greater the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece(Piece selectedPiece,
                         int startRow,
                         int startColumn,
                         int endRow,
                         int endColumn,
                         int die1,
                         int die2)
        Parameters:
        selectedPiece - a Piece object, used to determine its color, if it is a pawn with a flag, and other data as needed.
        startRow - The starting row where the selectedPiece was, must be between 0 and 4
        startColumn - The starting column where the selectedPiece was, must be between 0 and 4
        endRow - The desired row that the piece is to be moved to, endRow must be -1, 0, or 1 when subtracted from startRow or the method will return false
        endColumn - The desired column that the piece is to be moved to, endColumn must be -1, 0, or 1 when subtracted from start column or the method will return false.
        die1 - If a piece exists in the desired square a value must be taken to know whether the piece captures or not by using the capturePiece() method
        die2 - If a piece exists in the desired square a value must be taken to know whether the piece captures or not by using the capturePiece() method
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the move is considered to be valid. If a piece attempts to capture a piece but fails the method will not move the piece but will return true. startColumn - endColumn and startRow - endRow must both have a non 0 sum and a 0 sum between the two of them or the method will return false.

      • pieceCount

        public int pieceCount(java.lang.String color)
        Parameters:
        color - must be either "Blue", "Green", "Yellow", or "Red". If it is not, the method will return a 0
        Returns:
        a positive int value, it is expected that the value should be either 0, 1, 2, or 3.

      • setPieceLocationGameStart4Player

        public void setPieceLocationGameStart4Player()
        Sets the pieceLocation data field for a 4 player game.

      • setPieceLocationGameStart2Player

        public void setPieceLocationGameStart2Player()
        sets the pieceLocation data field for a 2 player game between blue and yellow

      • addPiece

        public void addPiece(java.lang.String color,
                     int row,
                     int column)
        Parameters:
        color - a string value, do not use any other color that isn't "Blue", "Green", "Yellow", or "Red".
        row - a positive int between 0 and 4. Any other int will cause an ArrayOutOfBounds error
        column - a positive int between 0 and 4. Any other int will cause an ArrayOutOfBounds error This method adds a pawn to the pieceLocation data field.

      • checkAndRemoveFlag

        public void checkAndRemoveFlag(Piece selectedPiece,
                               int endRow,
                               int endColumn)
        Parameters:
        selectedPiece - a Piece that appears on the pieceLocation data field. This method is called during the movePiece() method and uses the Piece object that is inputted their
        endRow - an int value between 0 and 4, any other value will cause an ArrayOutOfBounds error
        endColumn - an int value between 0 and 4, any other value will cause an ArrayOutOfBounds error if the selectedPiece is a certain color and reaches a certain location inside the pieceLocation data field, such as a blue piece with an enemy flag moves to (0, 2), then the method removes the selected flag and calls the removeTeam() method to remove the eliminated team.

      • remove

        public void remove(int row,
                   int column)
        Parameters:
        row - an int value between 0 and 4, any other value will result in an ArrayOutOfBounds error
        column - an int value between 0 and 4, any other value will result in an ArrayOutOfBounds error

      • removeTeam

        public void removeTeam(java.lang.String color)
        Parameters:
        color - must be either "Blue", "Green", "Yellow", or "Red". The method will not do anything for any other color
